alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 12 at 7:00PM EDT until March 12 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COVINGTON AND NORTHERN OKALOOSA COUNTIES... At 559 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles north of Florala to 6 miles south of Laurel Hill to Baker, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Crestview, Florala, Baker, Laurel Hill and Lockhart. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
